Om Birla.description: NEW DELHI: The new Lok Sabha Speaker, Om Birla, a two-time BJP MP from Rajasthan, is a relative newcomer for the post traditionally held by seniors.   A surprise pick by the ruling BJP-led NDA   , Birla's name was proposed by Prime Minister Narendra Modi himself for the post, sources said. The 56-year-old leader is considered to be close to both Modi and Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) president Amit Shah. Birla's nomination for the Lok Sabha Speaker's post also has the   backing of non-NDA parties   such as the YSR Congress Party (YSRCP) and the Biju Janata Dal (BJD). Starting his political journey as a student leader, Birla was also elected to the Rajasthan Assembly for three consecutive terms in 2003, 2008 and 2013. He won his first Lok Sabha election in 2014 and was again elected this year from Rajasthan's Kota-Bundi seat. Birla defeated Congress's Ramnarayan Meena with a margin of over 2.5 lakh votes in the recently-concluded general election. A conscientious parliamentarian, Birla has registered an 86-per cent average attendance in the House, asked 671 questions, participated in 163 debates and introduced six private members' bills in the 16th Lok Sabha. From 1991 to 2003, he was a key leader in the Bharatiya Janata Yuva Morcha (BJYM) as a state-level president first and then, as a vice-president at the national level. Birla, who holds a Masters degree in commerce, is a member of the Standing Committee on Energy in Parliament, the Committee on Petitions and the Consultative Committee for the Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment. He succeeds eight-time MP Sumitra Mahajan as the Lok Sabha Speaker, a post traditionally held by senior MPs. However, this is not the first time that a relative newcomer has occupied the position. In 1996, Telugu Desam Party (TDP) leader G M C Balayogi, also a two-time MP then, was elected as the Speaker in the Lower House of Parliament. After his death in a helicopter crash in 2002, Shiv Sena leader and first-time MP Manohar Joshi was appointed to the position. Pawan Kalyan.description: GUNTUR: Stating that they will bulldoze bastions of TDP and YSR Congress, Janasena president Pawan Kalyan promised to grant Rs 5,000 pension to all farmers in the state. He said they will also grant Rs 8,000 crop incentive to farmers soon after coming into power in the next elections. Pawan further said his government would provide six to 10 LPG cylinders free-of-cost to each family every year. and also promised to fill 3 lakh vacancies in the government departments to provide jobs to youth. Addressing a meeting in Guntur on Monday, Pawan said that the future of the state did not mean the future of Lokesh and Jagan but it was the future of the people. “The space on the state’s political stage is not TDP’s and YSRC’s property as youth and women are eager to bring change through Jana Sena.” “TDP had lost moral right to rule the state as chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu had no control over his legislators who indulged in illegal activities,” Pawan said adding that he jumped into the political arena to bring in a change in the lives of commoners. “We supported TDP and BJP in the last elections with a hope to transform the state. Unfortunately, both of them have shattered our dreams,” he said. “Guntur city has been left in a lurch despite located a few kilometres away from the capital city. The entire city has been dug out in the guise of laying underground drainage scheme and left without repair. How shocking it is to see 30 people dying of diarrhoea in a city like Guntur? Is it not the failure of the state government? Opposition leader Jaganmohan Reddy is equally responsible for the tragedy as he never dared to question the government by going to the assembly,” he said. He further said they would construct apartments exclusively for Muslims in the city. He appealed to people to support his candidates Chandrasekhar (Guntur West), Zia-Ur-Rehman (East) and MP candidate Bonaboina Srinivas Yadav in the elections, Pawan said they fielded a BC candidate Srinivasa Yadav whereas TDP and YSRC both have given tickets to their own communities. Mamata Banerjee.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Projecting TDP supremo and AP chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu as a “national leader of importance” and keeping the debate on the alternate front prospects in the ensuing elections alive, West Bengal chief minister and Trinamool Congress chief Mamata Banerjee appealed to people of AP to elect TDP again to keep the duo of Narendra Modi and Amit Shah away from power. “Who is Modi to ask about our Prime Minister candidate? We will decide who to elect our leader as there will be alternative for Modi,” she pointed out. Mamata said Naidu has done a lot for development of Andhra Pradesh. “It’s a necessity for AP people to give the power to Naidu again as he will play a key role in national politics and show a path of development to the entire country,” she added. Addressing a public meeting convened by TDP on Sunday, Mamata said Naidu is the leader to take the country forward. “Like he has done in Andhra Pradesh, Naidu can do a lot in Delhi,” she said. Coming down heavily on Modi, Mamata appealed the gathering to save the country and remove Modi (desh ko bachana hai to Modi ko hatao). “Modi claimed to be chaiwala after 2014 elections. Now he says he is chowkidar,” she added. “But chowkidar for whom? For those who looted the country. Modi had claimed that demonitisation would mitigate terrorism and stop black money, but ironically the number of terrorist attacks was the highest in the past two years. Under Modi’s regime, more number of farmers committed suicide and unemployment increased.” She added that Modi failed to explain the Pulawama incident and the Rafale deal and spurned the demand for an all-party meeting on the issues. “The nation does not want leaders like Narendra Modi and Amit Shah,” she asserted, and challenged Modi for an open debate on a national channel of his choice to discuss issues facing the country. Fear grips Nashik businessmen, police to.description: NASHIK: City's business community has been gripped with fear following the incident of attempted dacoity at Untawadi branch of a private finance company Friday morning. The businessmen have asked the police to step up vigil to prevent any such incidents in future. On Friday, six armed robbers entered the office of the Muthoot Finance and shot dead an IT engineer of the company, Sanju Samuel, when he tried to stop them from thrashing the branch manager for not handing over the keys of the strong room. "The incident is an indication about the rising confidence of criminals to strike even in broad daylight. There are thousands of businessmen who deal with huge amount of cash on daily basis and after Friday's incident they have become fearful," a city-based businessman said. According to him, police need to act swiftly to instill confidence among traders and businessmen. "There have been some incidents related to shop break-ins that are yet to be resolved. We feel that policing in the city has to be more impactful that would deter the goons from carrying out such activities," he said. The president of Maharashtra Chamber of Commerce, Industry and Agriculture (MACCIA), Santosh Mandlecha, confessed that the city businessmen have become fearful after that incident. "Our request to the police is take corrective measures immediately. We have an efficient police chief and the need of the hour is to identity the criminals and take strict action against them," he said. Gorakh Chaudhary, president of the Nashik Druggist and Chemist Association, said Friday's incident has raised question over the quality of policing in the city. "I feel that the city police should put in more efforts to ensure that the city is safe. Unless they send a strong message to the criminals, such incidents would continue to take place," he said. Meanwhile, police commissioner Vishwas Nagare Patil assured the businessmen that they would go all out to ensure that Nashik is a safe city. "The incident that took place on Friday is a rare one. Our investigation so far has revealed that an organised syndicate of criminals was behind it. We have already initiated several steps to prevent such incidents," he said. According to Nagare Patil, from Saturday five beat marshals and two vehicles have been provided to each of the 13 police stations across the city. "These beat marshals have been directed to undertake patrolling round-the-clock. And senior police officers will have to monitor the movement of the beat marshals several times on a daily basis," the police chief added. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Water scenario in Nashik gets grimmer, N.description: NASHIK: With monsoon playing truant, the city’s water scenario has become grimmer. Owing to this, from Monday, the Nashik Municipal Corporation (NMC) has imposed once-a-day water supply instead of the regular twice-a-day supply in all areas that come under Nashik Road and Panchavati divisions of the civic body. Moreover, the civic body has written to the water resources department (WRD) urging the latter to refrain from releasing water for any stakeholders from the Gangapur Dam complex. The civic body fears that any discharge of water from the dam complex would bring the water level below the intake well at the dam following which it would not be able to draw water. The intake well is the structure that allows NMC to safely draw water from the dam. “The water availability scenario has become stressed as there has virtually been no rain so far,” a civic official said. Water from the Gangapur Dam complex is released by the WRD on rotation for drinking and agricultural purposes for NMC, MIDC, farmers of the district and a small amount for Ahmednagar district. “If the water level of the dam depletes any further, we would not be able to lift water from the dam for city residents. Hence, we have written to the WRD on the issue,” the official said. The Gangapur Dam complex, which meets over 80% of city’s water requirement, currently has 1,097 mcft of water — around 11% of the total capacity of the dam. The remaining 20% of the requirement is met from Darna and Mukane dams. However, at present, the NMC has stopped lifting water from Darna since May 22 following some contamination of water. The NMC official said that of the 4,900 mcft of water reserved for the NMC from October 15 last year to July 31 this year in Gangapur Dam complex, the civic body has already used 3,873 mcft of water. Presently, the NMC’s daily requirement is 16mcft of water and it is lifting 13.5 mcft of water from Gangapur dam complex and remaining 2.5 mcft from Mukane dam. Meanwhile, the WRD called upon the NMC to supply water judiciously as there has been no rain yet. “Our water release rotation to most of the stakeholders is complete. We have to release about 35 mcft of water to MIDC and about 650 mfct to the NMC. They will get their share of water and it is up to the civic body how to use it,” a WRD official said. The youngsters are participating in different events ranging from discussions to musical programmes, dramas, short film making, poster making and various games. Several thought provoking discussions are also taking place and participants are engaged in creating mobile messages on subjects like environment, farming and unemployment, among others. The youngsters also created a song featuring 13 different languages, under the guidenace of music composer Rahul Ram. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Gangadashhera organised at Nashik.description: On Wednesday, Gangadashhera was organised in Nashik. Akhil Bhartiya Shri Swami Samartha Gurupith and Purohit Sangh organised Gangadashhera program at Ramkund.As a part of the program, various activities were carried out. He also stressed on the importance of conserving water, tree plantation and other activities to keep rivers clean Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

NAB gives 160 PlexTalk units to students.description: NASHIK: The Maharashtra unit of National Association for the Blind (NAB) had made 160 PlexTalk machines available to deserving children across the state. The machine - akin to a mobile - helps the children with visual disabilities to record lectures and even refer to various books stored in it and online. These can be replayed by the machine later. The machines have been given through the ministry of social justice and empowerment. "Every year, we receive some of these machines for the students. Earlier, we used to get record players, then came the CD players. Now, the PlexTalk devices are being provided to the students," Gopi Mayur, general secretary of NAB, Maharashtra said. The units will be given to students across the state and especially for those pursuing higher studies. "It helps children to record the lectures in the class and the even refer to any book that is required for the studies. The machine can even read out the book to the student. It also has a radio facility that helps the students in studies and even recreational purposes," Mukteshwar Munnshettiwar, joint general secretary said. The students, who have used the machine in the past, have advocated its use. "I have used the machine during my studies and it has been the best help for me. I could get access to any book and lecture through the machine given to us free of cost," said Shoib Pathan, a resident of Chalisgaon. Pathan is now seeking admission for BCA (Bachelor in Computer Applications) course in Pune. His sister, Heena, also has visual disabilities. Their parents, who are farmers, have ensured both the children study. Rajendra Tarange from Baramati, who also got the machine, said there were books in Braille till Class XII but no such literature was available thereafter. Students had to completely rely on the PlexTalk. "This product will change the lives of many like us," Tarange added. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\nAsha Murjani, Mamta Panjawani party to.description: Asha Murjani and Mamta Panjawani organised an all women party on the occasion of International Women’s Day last week. Competitions like best personality, most glamourously dressed, best western dress, best traditional dress and others were conducted at the do. The guests enjoyed themselves in various games including Housie. While some enjoyed the round of games played, some preferred dancing to some up-tempo music. The event also had a lavani performance presented by artiste Yugandhara. We spotted animal rights activist Sharanya Shetty, designer Ashi Luthra, Sunaina and Aanchal Madan, Vijaya Katakwar, Gunjan Ahuja at the event. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

AP BJP List 2019.description: NEW DELHI: The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), on Thursday, announced its first candidate list for the Lok Sabha elections 2019 that includes 184 candidates. The party has named two candidates from Andhra Pradesh in the first list. Kanna Lakshminarayana will contest from Narasaraopet Lok Sabha constituency while D Purandeshwari will contest from the Visakhapatnam seat. Andhra Pradesh will go to polls in a single phase on April 11. BJP's Lok Sabha first full list The Lok Sabha elections will be held in seven phases from April 11 to May 19, 2019. The counting of the votes has been scheduled for May 23. The first phase will be held on April 11, second on April 18, third on April 23 and fourth on April 29, fifth on May 6, sixth on May 12 and seventh phase on May 19. Prime Minister Narendra Modi will contest from Varanasi constituency, while BJP president Amit Shah will fight from Gandhinagar in place of L K Advani. As many as 90 crore electors, including 1.59 crore new voters aged 18-19 years, are registered to vote in the upcoming general election. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\nSachin Shinde and his troupe performed.description: This three-day fest held recently in the city was a cultural treat for Nashikites. Sachin Shinde and his troupe performed a Bollywood dance show and the audience also appreciated the performance by Raja Patki and Shruti Chandorkar.  The next day, music enthusiasts thoroughly enjoyed the show by percussionist Taufiq Qureshi. He mesmerised the crowd with his classical fusion music. The last day of the fest was dedicated to the evergreen and latest popular songs of Indian cinema. This musical night had singers Dr Neha Verma, Madhura Kumbhar and Mandar Apte taking the audience on a journey through the highs of cinema. Mayor Yatin Wagh and entrepreneur Ashok Katariya were spotted on the occasion.Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Lok Sabha Elections in Tamil Nadu.description: NEW DELHI: Tamil Nadu goes to polls in the second phase of the seven-phase elections. Elections to 39 parliamentary seats will take place on April 18 in a single-phase polling. Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesTOP CONTENDERSThe four-cornered contest features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). This time the elections are taking place sans the Dravidian stalwarts M Karunanidhi and J Jayalalithaa. AIADMK chief Jayalalithaa passed away in December 2016 while Karunanidhi died in August 2018. While the DMK is contesting on 20 seats, the Congress is fighting elections on 9 seats in Tamil Nadu. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesHOW MANY SEATS?Tamil Nadu has 39 Lok Sabha seats and one in neighbouring Puducherry. Here is the list of constituencies: Arakkonam, Arani, Chennai Central, Chennai North, Chennai South, Chidambaram(SC), Coimbatore, Cuddalore, Dharmapuri, Dindigul, Erode, Kallakurichi, Kancheepuram(SC), Kanyakumari, Karur, Krishnagiri, Madurai, Mayiladuthurai, Nagapattinam(SC), Namakkal Nilgiris(SC), Perambalur, Pollachi, Ramanathapuram, Salem, Sivaganga, Sriperumbudur, Tenkasi(SC), Thanjavur, Theni, Thiruvallur(SC), Thoothukudi, Tiruchirapalli, Tirunelveli, Tiruppur, Tiruvannamalai, Vellore, Villupuram(SC), Virudhunagar, Puducherry(Union Territory) KEY CONSTITUENCIESThe key constutuencies include Sivaganga, Chennai South, Chennai North, Chennai Central, Chidambaram(SC), Coimbatore, Cuddalore, Dharmapuri, Dindigul, Kanyakumari, Karur, Thoothukudi , Nilgiris(SC), Trichy, Vellore amd Arani. Tejashwi Yadav.description: PATNA/ BHAGALPUR: RJD chief Lalu Prasad’s younger son and leader of opposition in Bihar legislative assembly Tejashwi Prasad Yadav kicked off the Lok Sabha election campaign on Monday by addressing public meetings at Gaya, Banka and Bhagalpur in support of the Mahagathbandhan candidates. Close aides of Tejashwi said he is expected to address around 200 election meetings across the state over the next two months. “Tejashwi is the face of RJD and the star campaigner of Mahagathbandhan. He will be canvassing for candidates of all the Mahagathbandhan constituents — RJD, Congress, RLSP, HAM(S) and VIP. Thus, he will be addressing three to four election meetings every day,” Tejashwi’s political adviser Sanjay Yadav told TOI on Monday. Canvassing for RJD candidate Shailesh Kumar alias Bulo Mandal from Bhagalpur, Tejashwi came down heavily on NDA governments at the Centre and in state. He accused PM Narendra Modi of making false promises and propaganda to win the 2014 general election. “It won’t be repeated in the ensuing Lok Sabha elections,” Tejashwi said while raising questions about employment scenario and issues of Vijay Malaya, Nirav Modi, Mehul Chowksi and others who fled the country after swindling money from banks in India. Criticizing Nitish for snapping ties with RJD in 2017, Tejashwi said there was acute shortage of fertilizers, while the health services were also in a poor state. He accused deputy CM Sushil Kumar Modi of protecting those involved in the multi-crore Srijan scam in Bhagalpur and some other districts. Urging the audience to vote for the RJD candidate, Tejashwi said the Bhagalpur voters had showed a mirror to Modi by voting for RJD in 2014. “They should do the same this election as the NDA government stands exposed,” he said. Political observers feel Tejashwi has become a good orator, especially after coming out of power in July 2017 when CM Nitish Kumar snapped ties with RJD-led Mahagathbandhan and rejoined BJP-led NDA. “Though not as good as his father in terms of having a rustic touch, Tejashwi is a good orator in terms of eloquence,” said DM Diwakar, political observer and professor at AN Sinha Institute of Social Studies. Most financial institutions bereft of ar.description: NASHIK: The Nashik city police will make it mandatory for all financial institutions to deploy armed guards in the wake of the robbery attempt at Muthoot Finance Ltd office at Untawadi of Nashik on Friday. Muriyayikara Saju Samuel (29) , an IT professional working for the firm, was gunned down by armed robbers during a scuffle. Two other employees of the firm were injured after they were hit by revolver butts. Nashik police commissioner, Vishwas Nagare Patil, told TOI that no armed guard was deployed at the financial institution. He said the police were in the process of issuing notices to both state-owned banks and non-banking financial institutions to mandatorily hire armed guards. “All financial institutions, irrespective of the quantum of business they do, have to follow this rule. In case they need licences for firearms, we will approve them immediately,” Nagare Patil said. The police are in the process of ascertaining the exact number of financial institutions that do not have armed guards. “Deployment of armed guards at financial institutions acts as a deterrent to criminals. It is sad that many firms do not hire armed guards,” said police officials. Police officials have also appealed to jewellery shops to deploy armed guards at their outlets. The city police have started clicking snaps of guards dozing off at night and sending them to the concerned security agencies to alert them about the manner in which the guards discharge their duties. “After we sent some snaps to the owner of a jewellery shop, he made it mandatory for night guards to register biometric fingerprint attendance every 15 minutes to ensure that they do not fall asleep at night,” said police officials. An eco-friendly twist to a traditional c.description: The traditional Vatsavitri puja, which is done for the long life of husbands, took a twist in one of the celebrations in the city. Looking at the lack of banyan trees, which are significant in the celebration, a group of ladies from Nashik have united to plant banyan saplings. To avoid cutting of banyan tree branches and to celebrate the day in an eco-friendly way, members of the Green Revolution group planted 51 banyan trees at the Chunchale tekdi in the city. The team, headed by group member Chaitali Amrutkar, planted three feet high saplings on the tekdi and pledged to take care of them. pic- Green Revolution Facebook pageDownload The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP List 2019 WB.description: KOLKATA: The BJP in its first list of 28 candidates for West Bengal has pinned hopes on its veterans and defectors from the ruling Trinamool Congress to take on the Mamata Banerjee's government in the state. Of the 28 candidates, nearly 25 are new faces, with a thrust on active political workers rather than greenhorns from the glamour world. The saffron party, which bagged two Lok Sabha seats in the 2014 elections, is now targeting 23 of the state's 42 constituencies. BJP Lok Sabha first full listUnlike the TMC list, which had 18 new faces and a mix of both old-timers and greenhorns, hardcore politicians and personalities from the film industry, the BJP has put faith on its own leaders and defectors from other parties. There are four women candidates and one Muslim nominee in the first list. Of the candidates, five had recently defected to the saffron party from the Trinamool Congress and one from the CPI(M). West Bengal: Track here Lok Sabha elections' full coverageUnion minister and BJP MP from Asansol Lok Sabha constituency Babul Supriyo has been renominated from the same seat and is pitted against actor Moon Moon Sen of the TMC. State BJP president Dilip Ghosh will contest from Medinipur seat against TMC leader Manas Bhunia. BJP national secretary Rahul Sinha will take on TMC heavyweight Sudip Bandopadhyay in Kolkata North Lok Sabha seat. State BJP vice-president and Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose grandnephew, Chandra Kumar Bose will contest from Kolkata South Lok Sabha seat. Former IPS officer Bharati Ghosh, once known to be close to Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee, will be fighting against TMC candidate and actor Dipak Adhikary, popularly known as 'Dev', from Ghatal Lok Sabha constituency. The BJP has fielded former Trinamool Congress MLA Arjun Singh from Barrackpur Lok Sabha seat. Singh, who had recently joined the saffron party, has been pitted against TMCs Dinesh Trivedi. In Coochbebar Lok Sabha seat, the party has fielded former TMC youth leader Nishith Pramanik, while in Jadavpur Lok Sabha seat, expelled TMC MP Anupam Hazra will contest against TMC's Mimi Chakraborty, an actor by profession. Another former TMC MP Soumitra Khan, who joined the BJP in January, has been given ticket from Bishnupur(SC) Lok Sabha seat. Former CPI(M) MLA Khagen Murmu, who too had switched over to the BJP, will contest from Malda North seat and will take on TMCs Mausam Benazir Noor, who had recently defected to the party from the Congress, in Malda Uttar seat. The Lok Sabha elections in the state will be held from April 11 till May 19 in seven phases. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP List 2019 Maharashtra.description: AURANGABAD/KOLHAPUR: Sitting MPs Sunil Gaikwad (Latur) and Dilip Gandhi (Ahmednagar) were denied tickets for the forthcoming Lok Sabha elections in the BJP’s first national list of candidates announced on Thursday. The list included 16 names from Maharashtra. While speculations were rife that the party would not retain Gaikwad owing to his differences with some senior BJP leaders, what came as a surprise was the ticket going to Sudhakar Shrungare, a member of the Latur zilla parishad. However, Shrungare, who is in the construction business, was the popular choice of local BJP workers. Gaikwad had won the 2014 election by a majority of over 2.5 lakh votes. Considered to be close to Union minister Nitin Gadkari, he was reportedly at loggerheads with Latur district guardian minister Sambhaji Patil-Nilangekar. The nomination of Sujay Vikhe Patil, son of senior Congress leader Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil, from Ahmednagar instead of Gandhi was a foregone conclusion ever since he joined the party last week. Sujay, a neurosurgeon by profession, will be making his entry into politics with this nomination. His late grandfather, Balasaheb Vikhe Patil, was long associated with the Congress. | Full coverage of Lok Sabha elections in MaharashtraAmong other prominent leaders from Maharashtra in the first list of candidates are Union minister Nitin Gadkari from his hometown Nagpur, state BJP chief Raosaheb Danve from Jalna, Union MoS Hansraj Ahir from Chandrapur and Union MoS for defence Subash Bhamre from Dhule. Late BJP MP Gopinath Munde’s daughter, Pritam, who was elected to Parliament with a record majority after her father’s death, has been renominated from Beed. Sitting MP from Sangli Sanjay Patil has also been renominated, putting an end to speculation over any change in constituency. Patil’s candidature was opposed by a section of BJP leaders in Sangli. However, chief minister Devendra Fadnavis is understood to have called a meeting of local party leaders and resolved the differences. The party has also given tickets to Heena Gavit from Nandurbar, Raksha Khadse from Raver, Poonam Mahajan from Mumbai North Central, Kapil Patil from Bhiwandi, Sanjay Dhotre from Akola, Ramdas Tadas from Wardha, Ashok Nete from Gadchiroli and Gopal Shetty from Mumbai North. Demand for Rs 10k honorarium echoes at d.description: Nashik: The Accredited Social Health Activist (ASHA) and Block Facilitators today met resident deputy collector demanding an honorarium of Rs, 10,000 per month — started recently by Andhra Pradesh government — for their service in health sector.Led by All India Trade Union Congress (AITUC), the delegation submitted a charter of demand addressed to the state government. “These women are the ground level workers who move around villages and taluka to supervise the health schemes. The are paid a sum that barely covers the travel cost. They have to bear the rest of expenses,” said Raju Desale of AITUC, who was leading the delegation. The Andhra Pradesh government recently announced an honourarium of Rs 10,000 per month for the ASHA workers and the Block Facilitators after a long relentless struggle. “The remuneration we get is not even enough to cover the travel cost, leave alone feeding our families. We have pinned our hopes on some sort of help from the government as we reach out to the families in lower economic strata to help them stay healthy,” Maya Gholap, an ASHA worker, said. The job is very demanding, which includes travel, conducting meetings, following up the issues and report to the doctors. “It is a tough job as one needs to spend more than eight hours to move around and make people aware about health issues on a daily basis. Though we are social activists, it is no less than a job or service as lot of time goes into the work, which cuts down the time we spend in our earning sources like working in the field etc,” said another woman, pleading anonymity.Later, state health minister Eknath Shinde assured the delegation that a resolution in this regard will be adopted in ongoing assembly session.Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Yogi Adityanath.description: VARANASI: Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath slammed Congress president Rahul Gandhi for suddenly showing concern for the poor and asked why he didn’t ensure a minimum income scheme for them during Congress-led UPA regime when his mother Sonia Gandhi acted as ‘super prime minister’ and had a say in everything. Targeting Congress announcement of minimum income scheme for poor on coming to power, Yogi said, “Congress led UPA was in power in Centre from 2004 to 2014. Everybody knows how Rahul and his mother (Sonia Gandhi) were influential in UPA regime. However, in UPA’s 10-year regime Congress never showed the kind of sympathy for poor, unemployed, farmers and women of country like it is showing now for Pakistan.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Nashik civic body to approve building pl.description: NASHIK: Following the technical snags in the AutoDCR – the online software to approve building plans – along with the failure of contractor to rectify the software, the Nashik Municipal Corporation (NMC) has decided to give approval to building plan proposals and other procedure off-line instead of online. The civic body will start offline approvals from Tuesday. The city builders had made several complaints to commissioner about AutoDCR and had urged him to bring into effect offline procedure. The civic body had started an online system called Auto DCR for submission of building plans after a Pune-based private firm developed the software and monitored and implemented it two years ago. However, there have been several defects in the software. According to the officials, the online software does not operate as per the Development Control (DC) rules and it calculates FSI incorrectly. “We had issued notices and ultimatums to the company several times and asked them to rectify the software; however, they did not do it. There is no progress or improvement in the AutoDCR, NMC sources said. The municipal commissioner Radhakrishna Game has already given directive to the civic body to blacklist the concerned contractor. As there have been continuous complains by the city builders in approving the building plans and conducting other procedure through AutoDCR, we have decided to stop the functioning of the online system and start procedure manually,” NMC sources said. “We will start offline procedure of the town planning department for building plan approval from Tuesday,” they added. NMC gives a week's deadline to private c.description: NASHIK: The Nashik Municipal Corporation (NMC) has written to Tata Projects Ltd, giving them a seven day deadline to sign an agreement for the city smart light project. Tata Project has won the bid to install 92,000 smart LED lights across the city on a public-private-partnership (PPP). The NMC had given the letter of intent to the company around one-and-a-half months ago, to carry out the smart light project. As per the conditions set by the NMC, the company should sign an agreement with the municipal corporation within a month. However, the company is yet to sign an agreement with the NMC even after a month's time has passed. The civic body had also requested the company to sign an agreement a few days back and start working on the project. Hence, the NMC has given a letter to Tata Projects to sign an agreement with the civic body within a week. Otherwise, the NMC will go ahead with the tender conditions of the project, said sources from the civic body. LED street lights are to be installed in lieu of rights for sharing energy saving on a PPP basis for the entire city area on design, build, finance, operate, maintain, monetize and transfer basis. The project would overhaul the traditional system of street lighting in a big way by adopting a smart IT-enabled street lighting system. The project includes features like intelligent IT innovations for transportation, civic utilities and public safety without adding significantly more physical infrastructure and real-time data communications with low latency to improve safety and security. Moreover, the smart LED street lights are to be installed with functional features like remote dimming control, remote on-off option, timer, GPS map representation. The total project cost is Rs171 crore, which will be borne by the TPT. The company has quoted 60% energy savings and 5% power sharing with the NMC. Presently, the NMC is paying a Rs2.75 crore electricity bill per month. The smart LED street light project will enable the municipal corporation to save Rs12-13 lakh per month. BSP List 2019 UP.description: LUCKNOW: The BSP on Friday announced its first list of 11 candidates for the Lok Sabha elections 2019, fielding JD(S) turncoat Kunwar Danish Ali from Amroha. Ali, who was general secretary of the Janata Dal-Secular, quit the party and joined the Bahujan Samaj Party only last week. The BSP also declared Haji Fazulrahman its nominee from Saharanpur, Malook Nagar from Bijnore and Girish Chandra from Nagina, a party release said. Hazi Mohammad Yakoob has been fielded from Meerut, Satbeer Nagar from Gautam Buddh Nagar, Yogesh Verma from Bulandshahr, Ajit Baliyan from Aligarh, Manoj Kumar Soni from Agra, Rajveer Singh from Fatehpur Sikri and Ruchi Veera from Aonla. Mayawati's BSP is contesting 38 of the 80 Lok Sabha constituencies in Uttar Pradesh under the seat-sharing arrangement with Samajwadi Party and the Rashtriya Lok Dal. Maharashtra to make forest laws more str.description: NASHIK: Forest minister Sudhir Mungantiwar on Monday said that the forest acts would be made more stringent through amendments for its effective implementation. “There are many acts related to forest and green environment, but these are not adhered to by the departments concerned. There is compulsion to develop green belts in industrial estates of MIDC and in other projects by various departments, but it is not implemented effectively,” said Mungantiwar, adding that laws would be made more effective with provision for penalty for its better implementation. The minister was here in the city on Monday for the review meeting related to tree plantation drive in Nashik division. The state government has set a target of planting 33crore trees in 90 days from July 1 to September 30. Nashik division, which includes five districts, has been given the target of planting 5.04crore trees this year. Out of this, 1.92crore has been earmarked for Nashik district, 1.17crore for Ahmednagar, 1.15crore for Jalgaon district, 65 lakh for Dhule, and 91 lakh for Nandurbar districts. There are a total of 395 nurseries in Nashik division, and 6.95crore saplings are to be made available through these nurseries. Around 5.04crore plants are ready for plantation in the division, he said. “Currently, green cover in the state is 6.92%, which will be increased to 33% in the next few years. Hence, we are involving public in tree plantation drive,” said Mungantiwar. Around 24.15crore trees were planted in the past three years since 2016, and the survival rate is over 66%. We are also planning to develop green cover on small spaces in the state through the involvement of people. We will soon introduce new scheme in this connection shortly, he added. “There has been a piece of land owned by the state dairy development department, which has been transferred to the forest department. We are planning to transfer this land to the Nashik Municipal Corporation (NMC) to develop a zoo there," said Mungantiwar. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\u2018Congress-NCP will remain in opposi.description: NASHIK: Wishing the Nationalist Congress Party on its 20th anniversary on Monday, state minister for finance, planning and forest Sudhir Mungantiwar said the Congress and NCP will remain in opposition for the next 25 years. Addressing the media, Mungantiwar said people always support the party that operates in the interest of public. “The UPA led by Congress and NCP was in power at the Centre and state for 15 years. Now, it’s our turn. The BJP has been working in the interest of the people. Prime Minister Narendra Modi does whatever he says and hence people trusted him and gave the party an opportunity, Mungantiwar said. “I extend my wishes to the NCP on its anniversary and I wish that the party would continue to criticise BJP and it will remain in opposition for next 25 years,” he said. When asked about the next chief minister, Mungantiwar said, “BJP has its chief minister in the state and the next one too will be from BJP. Shiv Sena is our natural partner and both parties will have strong alliance in the coming assembly elections.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

PM Modi.description: JEYPORE: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday said his government had taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' in space and asked people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions and not just raise slogans. Launching his campaign in eastern India with a rally in Jeypore area of Odisha's Koraput district, the prime minister said the NDA government wouldn't have been able to do any development work in the country without the support of the people. He sought blessings from his supporters for the 2019 Lok Sabha elections and asserted that the NDA government has left no stone unturned to bring about development in the state. Land, air or space, we had courage to do surgical strikes: PM Modi"The NDA government has been working hard to develop road and rail infrastructure in the state. There is no dearth of funds when it comes to development work in the country. "In the last five years, the government has been able to build homes for eight lakh families, light up 3,000 houses and provide gas connections to 40 lakh homes," Modi stated. Referring to Mission Shakti, when India demonstrated anti-satellite (ASAT) missile capability by shooting down a live satellite, he said the government has taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' (watchman) in space. He came down heavily on opposition parties who he said "belittled" the space achievement. "Those that are criticising the anti-satellite technology will be given a befitting reply in the elections," he claimed, urging people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions, not the one that only raises slogans. Maharashtra Lok Sabha Constituencies.description: MUMBAI: Maharashtra, which has 48 parliamentary constituencies, will go to polls in four phases, starting April 11. In 2009 and 2014, Lok Sabha elections were held in three phases in Maharashtra On April 11, seven constituencies in Maharashtra’s Vidarbha region will go to polls - Nagpur, Wardha, Yavatmal-Washim, and the naxal-affected areas of Gadchiroli and Chandrapur. In the second phase on April 18, 10 constituencies - including three constituencies in Vidarbha, six in Marathwada and Solapur in western Maharashtra - go to elections. The third phase, on April 23, of polling will be held in Pune, Baramati, Jalgaon, Jalna, Aurangabad, Raigad and Ratnagiri-Sindhudurg, Sangli, Satara and Kolhapur. In the final phase on April 29, all six constituencies in Mumbai, Thane, Kalyan, Palghar and Bhiwandi will go to polls among the total 17 seats in the state. KEY CONSTITUENCIESAmong the key constituencies are Baramati and Nagpur featuring high-profile candidates such as Supriya Sule and Nitin Gadkari. Then there is Ahmednagar from where Sujay Vikhe Patil, son of senior Congress leader Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil, is contesting. Other important constituencies are Jalna, Chandrapur, Dhule, Beed, Sangli, Mumbai North Central, Mumbai North and Baramati.    CONSTITUENCIES CONTENDERS   Chandrapur Union MoS Hansraj Ahir (BJP); Suresh Dhanorkar (Congress)   Baramati Kanchan Kul (BJP); Supriya Sule (Congress)   Jalna State BJP chief Raosaheb Danve BJP; Vilas Keshavrao Autade (Congress)   Akola Sanjay Dhotre (BJP); Hidayat Patel (Congress)   Bhiwandi Kapil Patil(BJP); Suresh Kashinath Taware (Congress)    Nagpur Union minister Nitin Gadkari (BJP)   Ahmednagar Sujay Vikhe Patil (BJP)   Dhule Union MoS for defence Subash Bhamre (BJP)    Beed Late BJP MP Gopinath Munde’s daughter Pritam (BJP); Bajrang Sonawane (NCP)   Sangli Sitting MP Sanjay Patil (BJP)    Mumbai North Central Poonam Mahajan (BJP)    Aurangabad Subhash Zambad (Congress)   Gadchiroli Ashok Nete (BJP)   Mumbai North Gopal Shetty (BJP)    Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Arvind Kejriwal.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Delhi chief minister Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said that Congress President Rahul Gandhi has refused to forge an alliance with the AAP for the Lok Sabha polls in the national capital. Full coverage: Lok Sabha electionsTalking to reporters at the airport here, the AAP leader said he had met Gandhi recently and the Congress leader had refused to “join hands with the AAP”. Asked about Congress' Delhi unit president Sheila Dikshit's remarks that Kejriwal never approached her for an alliance, the chief minister said, “We have met Rahul Gandhi. Dikshit is not that important leader.” Kejriwal has been urging the Congress to stitch an alliance in Delhi for the Lok Sabha polls to keep the BJP away from power. Leaders in the Delhi unit of the Congress were divided over the issue of alliance with Dikshit and her three working presidents opposing it, party sources had said. A top source in the party had recently said that chances of alliance were "slim" considering its long term repercussions in Delhi. "The biggest question is how will Congress face the AAP in Assembly elections due in 2020 after the tie up. Also, the party does not gain much politically as it is being offered only 2-3 seats by Kejriwal," the source had said. Congress had drawn a blank in the 2014 parliamentary elections in Delhi. The talk of alliance was fuelled by the fact that the Congress and AAP had jointly polled more votes than the BJP that had walked away with all the seven seats in the national capital. Delhi has 7 Lok Sabha seats and it will go to polls on May 12. In Video:Congress refused to forge alliance with AAP for LS polls: KejriwalDownload The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Nagpur BJP Candidate List.description: NAGPUR: After deadline for withdrawal for the first phase of Lok Sabha polls, 31 out of 147 candidates, whose nomination papers were found valid in seven constituencies of Vidarbha, have withdrew their papers. Now, 116 candidates are in the election fray, according chief electoral officer. Those remaining in the fray across seven constituencies are — Wardha – 14, Ramtek – 16, Nagpur – 30, Bhandara-Gondia – 14, Chandrapur – 13, Yavatmal-Washim – 24 and Gadchiroli-Chimur – 5. BJP leaders in Bhandara-Gondia are heaving a sigh of relief as two of the four rebels, Khushal Bopche and Prakash Malgave, have withdrawn from the fray after hours of persuasion by them. However, Rajendra Patle is still in the fray. Virendra Jaiswal, who resigned from BJP before nominations, is not being considered rebel as he contests every time. BJP’s Sunil Mendhe is pitted against Nana Panchbudhe of NCP here. Bopche’s rebellion had created panic in the BJP camp as he is popular in the Pawar community and in general among OBCs. In Nagpur, Abdul Karim Patel and Ravikant Meshram, withdrew on Thursday, taking the total number to three. Pallavi Nandeshwar had withdrawn on Wednesday. In Ramtek, Sachin Shende, Gajanan Jambhulkar, Prakash Tembhurne, Ranjit Saphelkar and Lalit Shamkuwar have opted out of the race. In Yavatmal-Washim and Wardha, seven and two candidates respectively withdrew on the final day. One independent candidate withdrew his nomination in Gadchiroli-Chimur constituency on Thursday. (With inputs from TO Abraham & Balwant Dhage) Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

A showcase of art in the city.description: As a part of Kalasangam, a live painting activity was recently organsed in the Kusumagraj Pratisthan area. Participants and artists painted various landscapes in and around the area. Different mediums such as water painting, pen painting, etc, were used, leaving those who were present mesmerised. The artists also guided Nashikites on the use of canvas, water colour to paint. They also explained minute details to be kept in mind while painting a landscape. Artists like Shrikant Nagare painted portraits of people playing musical instruments while Vaishali Abhyankar, Nitin Bhindikar, Avisha Walkear and Deepali Nagare painted landscapes. some also captured nature on canvas. Cash, articles worth Rs 3 lakh stolen fr.description: Nashik: Cash and articles worth Rs three lakh were stolen from five cars stationed by the road side in different parts of the city over Sunday and Monday.The incidents took place in regions of Gangapur, Indiranagar, Sakarwada and Mumbai naka police stations where unknown persons took away the loot.The biggest robbery was registered at Pandit colony when cash of Rs 1.95 lakh was stolen from a car that came under the jurisdiction of the Sarkarwada police station. The police said that the complainant had parked his car in front of an apartment at around 12.30 pm on Monday, when some unidentified person smashed the rear window of the car and stole the cash kept inside it.At around 10 pm on Sunday in Indiranagar, few unidentified persons smashed the rear window of a car parked near a hotel and stole cash of Rs 11,000 kept inside it. The burglars also stole other important documents like a bank cheque, pass books of two different banks, etc.On the same night at around 9 pm, unidentified miscreants broke the rear glass of car parked near a hotel in Bhonsala Circle, College Road and stole away cash and articles worth Rs 45,000. The stolen articles included a cellphone; shoes, bank pass-book, etc said the Gangapur police.In another case registered with the Mumbai Naka police, cash of Rs 15,000 and a tablet worth Rs 10,000 was stolen from a car parked near Tupsakhre Lawns at around 3 pm on Monday. In this case, the criminals had broken the front window glass of the car to steal the cash and cellphone tablet.In the fifth incident, a laptop and other articles worth Rs 20,000 were stolen from a car parked in front of the City Centre Mall on Monday at around 4.20 pm. Even in this case, the miscreant had broken the front window of the car.Senior police officials said that car owners should ensure that they park their vehicles in safer places and not leave heavy cash or other valuable articles inside the vehicle.A few months ago, there were a series of such burglaries from cars which later stopped occurring. A senior police officer said that for such thefts, criminals targeted vehicles which are at relatively secluded places and there is no one around to watch the theft they are committing. The criminals made sure that the glass shattered by them does not make any noise.Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Satta King 2019.description: NEW DELHI: Satta Matka is a form of gambling or lottery that had originated before the Independence of India.Originally, the game of Matka gambling involved betting on the opening and closing rates of cotton as transmitted to the Bombay Cotton Exchange from the New York Cotton Exchange, via teleprinters.The modern-day Matka gambling/ Satta King is based on random number selection and betting. The players participating in the Satta Matka game/ gambling are required to choose the right number for winning the game. The player who wins the game becomes Satta King and is rewarded financially. Two of the most famous Matka games are - Kalyan and Worli. The Kalyan Matka gambling was started by Kalyanji Bhagat, a farmer from Gujarat, in 1962 and it ran for all days of the week. Another Matka gambling, New Worli Matka, was started by the Rattan Khatri in 1964 with slight modifications to the rules of the game. Khatri’s Matka ran only five days a week, from Monday to Friday.The modern Matka business is centred around Maharashtra.Some of the terms used in the game and their meaning is given below:    Term Meaning   Matka Matka means earthen pot that were used to draw numbers   Single Any digit between 0 and 9   Jodi/Pair Any pair of two digits between 00 and 99    Patti/Panna Three digit number    Open result / close result Outcome of matka betting   Berij Berij is last digit of jodi's/pair's sum The Google 2018 trends data shows that 'satta' and 'matka' were the top searched words in the Madhya Pradesh state in the year 2018. As per the Google data, 'satta' was the 4th most searched word with a score of 36 and 'matka' came 6th with a score of 23.Any form of Satta Matka gambling is illegal in India.Disclaimer: This content is for reference purpose only and The Times of India claims no ownership of this content. The Times of India does not support or promote piracy in any manner.Download The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

Health check-up camp for Nashik rural po.description: NASHIK : The Nashik rural police conducted health check-up plan for its personnel on account of Police Welfare Week that is celebrated every year in the first week of June. Senior officials of the rural police said that various welfare programmes are conducted around the year for police personnel and their family members. Awareness about health and health check-up camps was a regular feature in this. Meanwhile, on backdrop of the Police Welfare Week, personnel of the Pimpalgaon police station, Ozar police station, Wavi police station and MIDC police station underwent health check-up and dental check-up camps at the Wockhardt hospital, Apollo hospital, Ramole eye hospital and Saibaba heart hospital in the city. A large number of police employees and officials of the police stations took benefit of the free camp. Senior officials of the rural police said that similar camps will also be organised for officials and personnel of other police stations. There are a total 40 police stations under the Nashik rural police. Senior officials of Nashik police commissionerate said that they too organised various programmes for the officials and employees serving in the police commissionerate. A couple of years back, a large number of books were collected through donations from people for starting a library for the children of police personnel so that they could make use of such books to attempt and clear competitive exams for government jobs. Apart from this, the police has taken up various other programmes, like wishing police personnel on their birthdays, which also had took many police personnel by surprise. Nashik: Average wholesale price of onion.description: NASHIK: The average wholesale price of onions at Lasalgaon Agriculture Produce Market Committee (APMC) dropped by 10% following the central government's decision to remove incentives on onion export. In December last year, the central government had doubled the incentives from 5% to 10% to boost export and thereby stabilise the wholesale price of onions. The decision had been taken following a crash in wholesale price. The government removed the incentives on onion export last Thursday after the average wholesale price of onions shot up. The wholesale market, which was closed during the weekend, reopened on Monday. The average wholesale price of onion dropped from Rs 1,320 per quintal on Thursday to Rs 1,200 per quintal on Monday. While the average wholesale price of onions was recorded at Rs 1,200 per quintal at Lasalgaon APMC on Monday, the minimum and maximum wholesale onion price was recorded at Rs 600 per quintal and Rs 1,430 per quintal respectively on the same day. The drop in the wholesale price of onions is likely to prevail for a few days. "There has been a rise in the demand for onions as compared to the present supply. Hence, the average wholesale price of onions may increase and may also touch the Rs 1,500 per quintal-mark by the first week of July," said sources in the Lasalgaon APMC. Presently, there is no fresh harvest of onions till mid-October. The onions arriving in the market are the summer produce harvested in March and April. These onions have a shelf life of six months and farmers prefer storing this variety of onions with a hope of getting a better price. "Currently, farmers are busy planning the kharif crops to be sown. They will bring onions to the market only if they require money. The supply of onions will be comparatively low," said the sources from Lasalgaon APMC. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

AMMK Candidate List 2019.description: CHENNAI: AMMK deputy general secretary TTV Dhinakaran on Friday released the second and final list of candidates - 14 for the Lok Sabha polls and 9 for assembly bypoll in Tamil Nadu. The party has decided to field two of its heavyweight disqualified MLAs to contest Lok Sabha polls and to take on strong candidates from AIADMK alliance. Disqualified MLA from Andipatti and AMMK propaganda secretary, Thanga Tamilselvan, has been fielded from Theni Lok Sabha constituency, he will take on P Ravindranath Kumar, son of deputy chief minister and AIADMK coordinator O Paneerselvam. Disqualified MLA from Paapireddipatti and former minister P Palaniappan will be contesting the Lok Sabha polls from Dharmapuri constituency. He will take on PMK youth wing leader and former Union health minister Anbumani Ramadoss, who is contesting on behalf of the AIADMK-BJP-PMK alliance.| Full coverage of Lok Sabha elections in Tamil NaduBesides these two, AMMK has also selected another disqualified MLA, NG Parthibhan from Sholingar assembly segment, to contest Arakonam Lok Sabha constituency. He will take on former Unions minister of state S Jagathrakshakan of the DMK - Congress alliance on the seat. AMMK had earlier released its first list of 24 candidates for Lok Sabha and 9 candidates for assembly bypoll in the state last Sunday. Dhinakaran will release the party's manifesto for the Lok Sabha polls later during the day. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP List 2019 Tamilnadu.description: CHENNAI: The BJP's Tamil Nadu candidates list announced on Thursday was on expected lines, with Union minister Pon Radhakrishnan being fielded from Kanyakumari, state chief Tamilisai Soundararajan in Tuticorin, national secretary H Raja in Sivaganga, C P Radhakrishnan in Coimbatore and vice-president Nainar Nagendran in Ramanathapuram. While Pon Radhakrishnan and Raja will fight Congress, which is yet to name candidates for its nine seats in DMK alliance, Tamilisai will cross swords with DMK heavyweight Kanimozhi in Tuticorin. H Raja to contest from Sivaganga for third timeH Raja is contesting from Sivaganga for the third time. In 2014, he came third with 1.33 lakh votes, while in 1999, he came second. It will be a keenly fought battle between Tamilisai and DMK’s state women wing secretary and Rajya Sabha MP K Kanimozhi in Tuticorin. Though Tamilisai initially preferred to contest from Chennai South, which has a sizeable votebank for the party, she finally settled for Tuticorin. AIADMK was keen on retaining south Chennai for sitting MP, J Jayavardhan, son of fisheries minister D Jayakumar. Former TN BJP chief Radhakrishnan will face CPM’s P R Natarajan in Coimbatore. This is the fifth time that Radhakrishnan has been fielded in Coimbatore, a BJP stronghold. While he won two consecutive Lok Sabha elections in 1998 and 1999, he was defeated in the 2004 and 2014 polls. Nainar Nagendran has been pitted against DMK’s IUML candidate K Nawaz Kani. While the party made a quick decision on candidates for four constituencies, Ramanathapuram delayed matters considering the keen contest for the seat among some senior leaders. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Chandrababu Naidu.description: KURNOOL: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday launched a blistering attack on Andhra Pradesh chief minister and erstwhile ally N Chandrababu Naidu, calling him 'u-turn Babu', whose "intent" was not on state's development. Addressing a well-attended election rally here, he sought to reject Naidu's repeated attacks that his government neglected the state. Andhra Pradesh goes to siumultaneous elections to the 175-member assembly and 25 Lok Sabha seats in the first phase on April 11 with the BJP contesting them alone. Listing various initiatives taken by the NDA government for Andhra Pradesh, Modi said it was during his regime that the Vizag-Chennai industrial corridor was flagged off and approval for the first National Institute of Ocean Technology (NIOT) given. It was also the 'chowkidar' who cleared the first Indian Institute of Packaging (IIP) besides approving the greenfield petrochemical complex for the state, he said. "Five years ago, your one vote made me PM. Your Pradhan sewak worked selflessly day and night for the people of the country. Chowkidar kept the interest of the state in mind," he said. Modi also recalled that the NDA government sanctioned first central university in Anantpur. He accused Naidu, the Telugu Desam Party supremo, of pasting state government 'stickers' on the Central schemes. "For sure, I could have done more work. I just required the cooperation of the state government. I made all efforts from my side, but the person who is running the government (Naidu), his intention is not Andhra Pradesh's development," Modi said. Levelling charges of corruption and dynasty politics against Naidu, he said the election date of April 11 will usher in the "double engine" of the state's growth -- a BJP government both at the Centre and the state. There was debate going on in AP that there were 'schemes for corruption,' ranging from the creation of the new capital Amravati, the Prime Minister charged. "The people of Andhra Pradhesh know whose coffers are being filled.. when this chowkidar sought accounts, u-turn Babu took a u-turn from AP's growth and walked out from NDA," Modi lashed out. Naidu had snapped ties with the NDA in March last year, accusing the Centre of not honouring the "promised" special category status to Andhra Pradesh. Hitting out at the TDP supremo for getting close to the Congress, Modi said Naidu has "found friends who are on bail," apparently referring to Congress leaders Rahul Gandhi and Sonia Gandhi who are on bail in the National Herald case. Modi, who had in the past hit out at Naidu for alleged family politics, said the election should also see the "son set", and called for a new "sun rise." He deliberately stressed on the "son" part to drive home his point on dynasty politics targeting the AP chief minister and his son and state minister Nara Lokesh. Without elaborating, Modi mocked that Pakistan has now accepted Naidu's "friends" as "hero." Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

\nAmeya Yeravdekar tied the knot with Sw.description: Ameya Yeravdekar, grandson of educationist Dr SB Mujumdar, tied the knot with Swati Thorat on Saturday in the city. The wedding ceremony took place in a Maharashtrian style. At the venue, women draped in nauvari saris welcomed the esteemed guests who came to wish the couple. The highlight of the wedding was when Swati entered the venue in a palkhi and Ameya came on a horse. Swati’s parents Kalpana and Avinash Thorat were seen attending to the guests. We spotted Dr Vidya Yeravdekar along with her husband Dr Rajiv Yeravdekar interacting with the guests. Guardian minister Chhagan Bhujbal attended the wedding with his nephew MP Sameer Bhujbal and daughter-in-law Shefali Bhujbal. Educationist Sharvari and Ratan Luth were seen bonding with the families of the couple. Present at the do were Sanjivini Mujumdar, politicians Arjun Tile, Nana Mahale and Manikrao Kokate. Maharashtra: 40 cyclists finish 120-km r.description: NASHIK: Nashik cyclists' ‘Ye Re Ye Re Pavasa’ ride was held on Sunday with 40 cyclists finishing the ride. The ride was planned to welcome the rains. But as it rained a night before, riders couldn't enjoy the showers. On the contrary, they had to face extreme heat. Yet the cyclists successfully participated in the ride. There were two formats of 40-km- and 120-km ride. The ride started at 6am from Shivshakti Cycles, Gangapur Road. Forty km riders were to go up to Ozar and return to Pimprikar's Hospital by 8.15am whereas 120-km riders were to further pedal up to Sogras Phata near Chandvad and return by 12.40pm. While returning the riders had to face a great challenge of hot sun, humidity and head wind too. But they braved it all and rode on. On the other side, young kids too enjoyed 20-km fun and joy ride up to Gammat Jammat and back. They were throughout their journey supplied with sufficient hydration like water, lime water, energy drinks, bananas, oranges, chikki etc. Bhausaheb Kale of Shivshakti Cycles flagged off the riders. NRM team comprising of Paramjeet and Davinder Singh Bhela, Chandrakant Naik, Mohan Desai and Suresh Dongre ensured meticulous planning and execution. They were duly assisted by Satish Mahajan, Shishir Acharya, Vaishali Marathe, Yash Desai, Dattatraya Borude and Dinesh Ingole. Next NRM 3.7 ride has been planned on July 14 as a tribute ride in the loving memory of Jaspal Singh Virdi, former president of Nashik Cyclists. \nBhushan Pradhan and Mrinmai Kolwalkar.description: The cast of the upcoming movie 'Mismatch' was in town recently. The movie is about a girl who doesn’t believe in the concept of arranged marriage and how she is told to find a suitable match for herself by her parents. It has Bhushan Pradhan and Mrinmai Kolwalkar in lead roles. The cast along with producer Alok Shrivastava visited the Sai Baba temple and Salim’s Chai where many youngsters were eager to click photos with them.  This is Mrunmai’s debut film and she is pretty excited about it, “I always wanted to be an actor. After modeling for a while, I got this script which was very good and so I had no reason to reject it,” she said. Bhushan on his part has taken a liking to working out. He said, “I started working out for Timepass-TP and have since been addicted to it. It’s a good addiction and I suggest everyone should work out to stay fit.” Apart from sipping some cutting chai at Salim mamu’s stall, the actors were busy taking selfies with those present. — Prajkat Mudholkar Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Thieves target parked cars again, steal.description: NASHIK: A burglar smashed the glass of a car parked in the Gangapur Road area and stole a laptop and other electronic gadgets collectively worth Rs22,000. The incident took place at 8.30am on Tuesday. The Gangapur police said the owner of the car has registered a complaint with them about the theft. According to the complainant, he had parked his car on Gangapur road, opposite Shri Guruji Hospital, at 8.30am on Tuesday. While the complainant was away from the car for some personal work, someone came to the car, broke its rear window with some instrument and stole a laptop worth Rs20,000 and other electronic gadgets kept inside the car. On Monday, five such cases were registered with the Gangapur, Indiranagar, Sarkarwada and Mumbai Naka police stations of the city. Of the five cases, two were registered with the Gangapur police station. In the two cases, while Rs45,000 was stolen from a car parked near a hotel at Bhonsala Circle, in another case, articles worth Rs20,000 were stolen from a car parked in front of the City Centre Mall on Monday at 4.20pm. The police said that a large number of cars are parked on the city streets. Burglars spot cars which have cash or other valuables inside them and on finding that no one is around, they smash the car windows to commit the crime. The police said that burglars conduct a recce to ensure that they are not spotted by anyone at the time of breaking the glass of the cars so that they can easily escape from the scene after committing the theft. A senior official of the Gangapur police station said that they would be keeping a vigil at secluded places where cars are parked, in order to trace the criminals who are committing such thefts. A few months back, similar thefts had been registered in the city. After a few days, such cases had completely stopped. Senior police officials suspect the involvement of some gang from outside the city in these offences. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Man who cheated grape growers of Rs 1.5.description: NASHIK: The Nashik rural police have arrested a conman, who cheated grape growers from Niphad, Pimpalgaon, Ozar, Vadner and other parts of the district to the tune of Rs 1.5 crore. The suspect is identified as Yogesh Shirsath, resident of Vadner Bhairav in Nashik district. The police said that the suspect, himself a grape grower had started a firm Exim Enterprises, a few months back had won the trust of farmers by buying their produce and giving a good price for the same. Subsequently, he bought grapes in huge quantities from grape growers of Vadner Bhairav, Ozar and other villages where grapes are produced on a large scale. However, he did not pay the farmers the worth of their produce and started avoiding them. Shirsath then left the Vadner Bhairav after which the farmers of the concerned villages lodged a case of cheating against him with the Vadner Bhairav police station. The farmers stated that they were cheated of Rs 1.5 crore by Shirsath. The farmers later came to know that Shirsath had escaped to Saudi Arabia. Meanwhile, the Nashik rural police on the instructions of SP Arti Singh were keeping a strict vigil to ensure that Shirsath was immediately nabbed once he returned to India. After awaiting his return for three months, the police got information that Shirsath had come back to Nashik. The police subsequently started keeping a watch on his friends and relatives. The police then got a tip-off that Shirsath was hiding in the Satpur or Khutwadnagar area of Nashik city. The rural police then laid a trap and arrested him from the MICO circle area of Nashik city. Expert appeals to doctors to improve soc.description: NASHIK: Magsaysay awardee Dr Bharat Vatwani has exhorted medicos to improve their social consciousness and work selflessly in the interest of the numerous patients in the society, who need psychiatrists’ attention in large numbers. “The major problem in our country is that people don’t recognize ‘mental illnesses’ at all. This is where the role of medicos comes into play. The medicos have to strengthen their social awareness and consciousness and reach out to the people in need,” said Dr Vatwani. He was the chief guest at the 21st anniversary of the Maharashtra University of Health Sciences (MUHS). Vice-Chancellor Dileep Mhaisekar, Pro-VC Mohan Khamgaonkar and several others were also present at the programme. “The country has a huge number of people who need psychiatrists to treat them. There are young and old professionals like doctors and engineers in that category as well. The country requires a very strong and large force to deal with the patients. At this point of time, any numbers that are coming in for help will still fall short,” said Dr Vatwani, who, through his Shraddha Rehabilitation Foundation, has so far searched, treated, restored and reunited at least 2,000 mentally ill people with their families — who had lost hopes of the same — across the country. Dr Dileep Mhaisekar, in his presidential address, pointed out that mobile technology was having a damaging effect on the brain and that regular yoga could help the brain in these trying conditions of the modern age. “While we are dealing with technology, that is apparently making life easier, the same technology on the other hand is taking a toll on human life. The over-use of mobiles is affecting people’s brains and is making life miserable, the World Health Organisation (WHO) has noted,” said Dr Mhaisekar. Dr Mhaisekar went on to add that people should practice yoga in order to help the mind and the body steer clear of the problems that may be caused due to modern technology. “Practice yoga regularly to come out of any chronic physical and mental illnesses as well,” he said. In all, 50 gold medals were presented to 41 students from the first year to the third year for doing well in various subjects. Of these, 11 students were from medical, three from the dental branch, eight from the Ayurved and Unani branches, four from homeopathy and 15 students from allied branches. Bank official foils robbery bid in Raver.description: NASHIK: Two armed robbers shot dead the assistant branch manager of Vijaya Bank at Nimbol village in Raver taluka of Jalgaon district, around 310km from here, on Tuesday afternoon. The incident was a near re-run of the shooting that left an IT engineer dead at the office of Muthoot Finance Company in Nashik city just four days ago. The criminals fired once at Karan Singh Negi (31), who foiled the robbery attempt and got the duo fleeing for the exit by pressing the burglar alarm. Negi was hit by the bullet in the shoulder and died on the way to hospital following excessive bleeding. Police said the robbers came to the bank on a motorcycle wearing black helmets. They did not take off their helmets as they entered the bank brandishing revolvers around 2.20pm. One of them fired a bullet at a wall in the bank in an attempt to frighten the five bank employees, including two women. Bank official foils robbery bid in Raver village, killedJalgaon superintendent of police Panjabrao Ugle told TOI that one of the robbers tried to overpower Negi at his workstation. “However, Negi immediately bent down and pressed the burglar alarm, which caught the goons off guard. They quickly turned to the exit. When Negi stood up, one of the robbers fired at him. The bullet hit Negi in the right shoulder and he collapsed on the floor,” he said. Negi, who hails from Himachal Pradesh, was living in a rented house in Nimbol. Police officials commended him for displaying alacrity by pressing the alarm, which prevented the criminals from robbing the bank. Bank officials said the branch manager was out for a meeting when the robbers entered. “It is extremely painful that Negi died in such a gruesome manner,” a senior bank functionary said. On June 14, IT engineer M Saju Samuel was shot dead when he took on six armed robbers at the office of Muthoot Finance Company in Nashik city. Samuel too had pressed the burglar alarm after the robbers stormed in, which forced them to flee without taking anything. The Vijaya Bank branch at Nimbol is around 17km from the Madhya Pradesh border. The Jalgaon police enforced nakabandi across Jalgaon district and along the roads leading to the MP border. Ugle said the two robbers spoke in both Marathi and Hindi. The police said they were yet to establish in which direction the robbers had fled. Officials and personnel from the Nimbhora police station, which is 17km away from Nimbol, rushed to the bank around 3pm. Some villagers told the police that they had seen the two robbers spend time sitting in the compound of an empty house opposite the bank. “They left a water bottle there. They were probably waiting for the right time to enter the bank. There were no customers in the bank when they entered,” a police official said. Meanwhile, the state home department has taken a strong view of the two armed robberies at two financial institutions in North Maharashtra within a span of just five days. Minister of state for home Deepak Kesarkar said he was upset with the Jalgaon police for the shooting at Vijaya Bank. “After the Nashik shooting incident, the police in all districts in the region should have been on high alert. I will speak to the director general of police on the issue. The police have to be on their toes,” he added. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

MIDC to set up plastic park in Malegaon.description: NASHIK: State industries minister Subhash Desai on Friday announced that Maharashtra Industrial Development Corporation would set up a new plastic park at Ajang in Malegaon taluka of the district. "There is an excessive use of plastic in our day-to-day life. We can't exile plastic from our life but we should ensure it does not affect human life," said Desai during a visit to Nashik. The park will also house a recycling centre. "We are setting up a new plastic park at Ajang in Malegaon taluka. This will help provide all the facilities required by the plastic manufacturing units. This will also help attract investment for the plastic manufacturing units. The park will also have a recycling centre," he added. Desai said that the land allotment is being started for three new industrial estates at Talegaon-Akrale in Dindori, Ajang, and Sayane in Malegaon taluka. The registration for the allotment of land for Sayane and Ajang were started in the presence of Desai on Friday in Malegaon. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Tamil Nadu Elections.description: Voting for Lok Sabha elections 2019 in Tamil Nadu will take place in a single phase on April 18 as per the notification issued by the Election Commission of India. The counting of votes will take place on May 23. | Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesThe four-cornered contest for the 39 Lok Sabha seats features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). Out of the 39 seats in the state, seven Lok Sabha seats are reserved for SC. The constituencies reserved for SC candidates are Thiruvallur, Kancheepuram, Villupuram, Nilgiris, Chidambaram, Nagapattinam and Tenkasi in Tamil Nadu. | Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesIn the last Lok Sabha polls, AIADMK had a vote share of 44.3 per cent by winning 37 seats. BJP had a vote share of 5.5 per cent by winning just 1 seat, while NDA managed to win two seats with a vote share of 18.5 per cent PMK won one seat and had a vote share of 4.4 per cent. BJP (NDA) had an alliance with PMK. DMK was not able to win on any seat in the last Lok Sabha polls. In Lok Sabha elections 2019, DMK is contesting on 20 seats, while the Congress is fighting elections on 9 seats in Tamil Nadu. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. \nKathak maestros performed with their s.description: Kathak maestros Vidyahari Deshpande, Rekha Nadgauda and Sanjeevni Kulkarni performed with their students on Saturday to welcome the festival of Diwali. The programme was based on the theme tarana, trivat, satrang and sargam. The last performance saw all three dance maestros on the stage together. Every year, Vidyahari, Rekha and Sanjeevni meet on the day of Diwali and perform together. The highlight of the show was Vidyahari’s solo performance on Haiku.
